did.abstract: One sworn affidavit (1779) and one sworn statement (1780) related to the home and property of Adrian Voorhees of Flatbush during the Revolutionary War.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Adrian Voorhees sworn statements, 1977.639, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains an original and typed copy of a sworn affidavit, signed by Major O. Tavles and dated September 14, 1779, stating that as a prisoner of war in the home of Adrian Voorhees of Flatbush, he was treated well. Also included is a sworn statement from Voorhees, dated August 4, 1780, stating that two horses and a wagon had been taken from him by Hessians, for which he was never compensated.
